00014 /*! \file
00015  *
00016  * \brief Resource limits
00017  *
00018  * \author Tilghman Lesher <res_limit_200607@the-tilghman.com>
00019  */
00020 
00021 
00022 #include "asterisk.h"
00023 
00024 #include <stdio.h>
00025 #include <stdlib.h>
00026 #include <unistd.h>
00027 #define _XOPEN_SOURCE 600
00028 #include <string.h>
00029 #include <ctype.h>
00030 #include <sys/time.h>
00031 #include <sys/resource.h>
00032 #include <errno.h>
00033 #include "asterisk/module.h"
00034 #include "asterisk/cli.h"
00035 
00036 /* Find proper rlimit for virtual memory */
00037 #ifdef RLIMIT_AS
00038 #define VMEM_DEF RLIMIT_AS
00039 #else
00040 #ifdef RLIMIT_VMEM
00041 #define VMEM_DEF RLIMIT_VMEM
00042 #endif
00043 #endif
00044 
00045 static struct limits {
00046    int resource;
00047    char limit[3];
00048    char desc[40];
00049 } limits[] = {
00050    { RLIMIT_CPU, "-t", "cpu time" },
00051    { RLIMIT_FSIZE, "-f", "file size" },
00052    { RLIMIT_DATA, "-d", "program data segment" },
00053    { RLIMIT_STACK, "-s", "program stack size" },
00054    { RLIMIT_CORE, "-c", "core file size" },
00055 #ifdef RLIMIT_RSS
00056    { RLIMIT_RSS, "-m", "resident memory" },
00057    { RLIMIT_NPROC, "-u", "number of processes" },
00058    { RLIMIT_MEMLOCK, "-l", "amount of memory locked into RAM" },
00059 #endif
00060    { RLIMIT_NOFILE, "-n", "number of file descriptors" },
00061 #ifdef VMEM_DEF
00062    { VMEM_DEF, "-v", "virtual memory" },
00063 #endif
00064 };
00065 
00066 static int str2limit(const char *string)
00067 {
00068    size_t i;
00069    for (i = 0; i < sizeof(limits) / sizeof(limits[0]); i++) {
00070       if (!strcasecmp(string, limits[i].limit))
00071          return limits[i].resource;
00072    }
00073    return -1;
00074 }
00075 
00076 static const char *str2desc(const char *string)
00077 {
00078    size_t i;
00079    for (i = 0; i < sizeof(limits) / sizeof(limits[0]); i++) {
00080       if (!strcmp(string, limits[i].limit))
00081          return limits[i].desc;
00082    }
00083    return "<unknown>";
00084 }
00085 
00086 static int my_ulimit(int fd, int argc, char **argv)
00087 {
00088    int resource;
00089    struct rlimit rlimit = { 0, 0 };
00090    if (argc > 3)
00091       return RESULT_SHOWUSAGE;
00092 
00093    if (argc == 1) {
00094       char arg2[3];
00095       char *newargv[2] = { "ulimit", arg2 };
00096       for (resource = 0; resource < sizeof(limits) / sizeof(limits[0]); resource++) {
00097          ast_copy_string(arg2, limits[resource].limit, sizeof(arg2));
00098          my_ulimit(fd, 2, newargv);
00099       }
00100       return RESULT_SUCCESS;
00101    } else {
00102       resource = str2limit(argv[1]);
00103       if (resource == -1) {
00104          ast_cli(fd, "Unknown resource\n");
00105          return RESULT_FAILURE;
00106       }
00107 
00108       if (argc == 3) {
00109          int x;
00110          if (resource != RLIMIT_NOFILE && resource != RLIMIT_CORE && resource != RLIMIT_NPROC && resource != RLIMIT_FSIZE) {
00111             ast_cli(fd, "Resource not permitted to be set\n");
00112             return RESULT_FAILURE;
00113          }
00114 
00115          sscanf(argv[2], "%d", &x);
00116          rlimit.rlim_max = rlimit.rlim_cur = x;
00117          setrlimit(resource, &rlimit);
00118          return RESULT_SUCCESS;
00119       } else {
00120          if (!getrlimit(resource, &rlimit)) {
00121             char printlimit[32];
00122             const char *desc;
00123             if (rlimit.rlim_max == RLIM_INFINITY)
00124                ast_copy_string(printlimit, "effectively unlimited", sizeof(printlimit));
00125             else
00126                snprintf(printlimit, sizeof(printlimit), "limited to %d", (int)rlimit.rlim_cur);
00127             desc = str2desc(argv[1]);
00128             ast_cli(fd, "%c%s (%s) is %s.\n", toupper(desc[0]), desc + 1, argv[1], printlimit);
00129          } else
00130             ast_cli(fd, "Could not retrieve resource limits for %s: %s\n", str2desc(argv[1]), strerror(errno));
00131          return RESULT_SUCCESS;
00132       }
00133    }
00134 }
00135 
00136 static char *complete_ulimit(const char *line, const char *word, int pos, int state)
00137 {
00138    int which = 0, i;
00139    int wordlen = strlen(word);
00140 
00141    if (pos > 2)
00142       return NULL;
00143    for (i = 0; i < sizeof(limits) / sizeof(limits[0]); i++) {
00144       if (!strncasecmp(limits[i].limit, word, wordlen)) {
00145          if (++which > state)
00146             return ast_strdup(limits[i].limit);
00147       }
00148    }
00149    return NULL;
00150 }
00151 
00152 static const char ulimit_usage[] =
00153 "Usage: ulimit {-d|-l|-f|-m|-s|-t|-u|-v|-c|-n} [<num>]\n"
00154 "       Shows or sets the corresponding resource limit.\n"
00155 "         -d  Process data segment [readonly]\n"
00156 "         -l  Memory lock size [readonly]\n"
00157 "         -f  File size\n"
00158 "         -m  Process resident memory [readonly]\n"
00159 "         -s  Process stack size [readonly]\n"
00160 "         -t  CPU usage [readonly]\n"
00161 "         -u  Child processes\n"
00162 #ifdef VMEM_DEF
00163 "         -v  Process virtual memory [readonly]\n"
00164 #endif
00165 "         -c  Core dump file size\n"
00166 "         -n  Number of file descriptors\n";
00167 
00168 static struct ast_cli_entry cli_ulimit = {
00169    { "ulimit", NULL }, my_ulimit,
00170    "Set or show process resource limits", ulimit_usage, complete_ulimit };
00171 
00172 static int unload_module(void)
00173 {
00174    return ast_cli_unregister(&cli_ulimit);
00175 }
00176 
00177 static int load_module(void)
00178 {
00179    return ast_cli_register(&cli_ulimit)? AST_MODULE_LOAD_FAILURE: AST_MODULE_LOAD_SUCCESS;
00180 }
00181 
00182 AST_MODULE_INFO_STANDARD(ASTERISK_GPL_KEY, "Resource limits");
